page.title: 15LANDSCAPE:BED'HM:HED'HM
page.content: The land slopes from 125' ASL in the south to 100' in the north,where an initially gentle valley made by Broome Beck thro' the sandy gravel WNW to ESE becomes increasingly steep-sided as it cuts thro' Hedenham.Both churches over look the valley.Bedingham's old gravel pits are fished & slowly revert to the wild.The landscape is open,but copse, hedge & parkland trees give a wooded impression.The area is rich in old buildings;26 are listed.Bedingham church:Saxo-Norman round tower & octa- gonal top,C13-15 nave,aisles & windows -is outstanding;Hedenham's square tow- ered church,restored 1860,has C13-14 work.Houses range from C14-20;C17 Hed- enham Hall is Grade II*,& the parishes each have 6+ moated sites.The council housing deserves comment,most was designed by Civic Trust award-winning firm,Taylor & Green for Loddon RDC.
